section.title: Past simple: regular and irregular verbs
section.sectiontitle: We use the Past simple for a finished action in the past. We often say the time of the action.
section.sectiontitle2: We use the Past simple for a finished state or a repeated action in the past.
section.text3a: We lived in India when I was young.
section.text4a: We went to the beach every day.

section.title: Past simple: regular and irregular verbs
section.sectiontitle: We usually add -ed or -d to the verb to make the Past simple.
section.sectiontitle2: With verbs ending in a consonant + -y, we change the -y to -ied.
section.text3a: Sarah studied at Harvard for four years.

section.title: Past simple: regular and irregular verbs
section.sectiontitle: With verbs ending in a consonant + vowel + consonant, we usually double the final consonant.
section.sectiontitle2: Many common verbs have an irregular past form, e.g. go, meet, have, know, leave, make, write.
section.text3: We often go to the cinema.
section.text3a: We went to the cinema last night.
section.text4: I write a lot of e-mails.
section.text4a: I wrote a lot of e-mails yesterday.
